description: Construction of a three storey building to provide 3 self-contained flats.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: 1518-P/EX/01 (Location Plan & Existing Site, Ground Floor & First Floor Plans), 1518-P/EX/02 (Existing Front, Rear & Side Elevations), 1518-P/P/01revA2 (Proposed Site & Ground Floor Plans), 1518-P/P/02revB2 (Proposed First Floor, Second Floor & Roof Plans), 1518-P/P/03revB2 (Proposed Front/Street Scene & Rear Elevations), 1518-P/P/04revB2 (Proposed Sectional Elevations A-A, B-B & C-C), 1518-P/P/05revB2 (Proposed Front/Street Scene & Rear Elevations Showing Materiality), 1518-P/P/06revB2 (Proposed Sectional Elevations A-A & B-B Showing Materiality), 1518-P/P/07 (Proposed Sectional Elevation C-C Showing Materiality), 1518-P/P/08revB2 (Photo Montage/3D Image of Proposed Development & Surroundings), 1518-P/P/09revB2 (Photo Montage/3D Image of Proposed Development & Surroundings) and Planning Statement for 74 Churchfield Road, Acton, W3 6DH produced by Boyer and dated June 2020.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All materials to be used for the external surfaces of the hereby approved development shall match the description and details of the materials annotated within the approved drawings/documents listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the Ealing Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | A minimum of six (6) cycle storage spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with the location identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The cycle storage area  shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (Housing) (2012). | A minimum of two (2) 360L refuse and two (2) 360L recycling bins shall be provided on site in accordance with the location identified within the drawings and documents listed under condition 2. The refuse store shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To provide waste storage facilities, in accordance with policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and SPG4 Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and external amenity areas shall be in accordance with the Council's assessment standards of the SPG10 and achieve compliance with the acoustic criteria specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self noise).

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, bathroom and balcony above/below bedroom of separate dwelling, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Standard 30 of the Housing SPG. | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a construction management plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing. Details shall include control measures for:
(i) noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014);
(ii) dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition);
(iii) lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals);
(v) hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays;
(vii) notifications to interested parties and public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The hereby approved rooflights shall not project more than 150mm beyond the plane of the roof slope when measured perpendicularly.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
